item.title: DeepOF
item.description: A suite for postprocessing time-series extracted from videos of freely moving rodents using DeepLabCut and SLEAP.

item.title: International Conference on Machine Learning 2024
item.description: My impressions, thoughts, and favourite papers on the 2024 edition of ICML, which I attended in person in Vienna.

item.title: Mental health, explained for everyone
item.description: As part of the science communication group within the Max Planck Institute of Psychiatry, we wrote and released a booklet on mental health and mental health research for children. Come and check it out!

item.title: Multimodal learning in clinical proteomics
item.description: Predicting antimicrobial resistance in clinical settings could have significant impact for patients. Here, we extend the current state of the art by incorporating antibiotic structural information into our models.

item.title: Neural Information Processing Systems 2023
item.description: My impressions, thoughts, and favourite papers on the 2023 edition of NeurIPS, which I attended in person in New Orleans.

item.title: Single cell spatial proteomics maps human liver zonation patterns and their vulnerability to fibrosis
Detecting antimicrobial resistance through MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry with statistical guarantees using conformal prediction
Sex-specific fear acquisition following early life stress is linked to amygdala and hippocampal purine and glutamate metabolism
Deep clustering of animal motion tracking data: software development and applications to psychiatric preclinical research
About me
item.description:
You have reached my digital home. Here you’ll find content about my professional life, including scientific publications, projects, software, and (some) general interest blog entries.

My name is Lucas Miranda. I was born and raised in Buenos Aires, Argentina, where I studied molecular biology and bioinformatics at the University of Buenos Aires. I recently completed my doctorate at the Technical University of Munich, directed by Bertram Müller-Myhsok at the Max Planck Institute of Psychiatry. If you’re interested, you can read my thesis here.
